poem:
"Digital Apples of Our Gaze"

In the realm of screen-tapped lives,
Instagram, adorned in Reels,
usurps the throne of TikTok's dive,
within the digital fields.

Kardashians, set against the sky,
in cyber spaces prevail.
Yet like red wheelbarrows, we try
to hold weight in the digital veil.

Outpaced now, short dances whorl,
on a new platform, they uncurl.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Instagram overtakes TikTok as world’s most downloaded app Instagram has overtaken TikTok as the world’s most downloaded app after its copycat video feature Reels helped it recover ground lost to its Chinese-owned rival. The photo- and videosharing app soared in popularity after its launch in 2010 alongside reality royalty such as the Kardashians and is a cornerstone of the influencer phenomenon, but has faced stiff competition on its own territory in recent years from TikTok,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
